title: 104_hr3117
content: AUTHORITY TO ESTABLISH AND OPERATE MANAGED HEALTH-CARE PLANS. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs may establish managed health-care plans to deliver health services to veterans through Department facilities or other entities. These plans must meet standards set by the Secretary and provide minimum health care benefits to enrolled veterans. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs may establish managed health-care plans for veterans, with minimum health benefits including those covered under Medicare. The Secretary can enroll veterans in the plan and set cost-sharing requirements to cover additional benefits not paid by Medicare. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs can establish managed health-care plans for veterans with cost-sharing requirements for additional benefits not covered by Medicare. Payments received for care provided to veterans enrolled in the plan will be used to cover costs. The plan cannot operate at a Department facility unless sufficient medical care funds are allotted for that fiscal year. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs can establish managed health-care plans for veterans with cost-sharing requirements for additional benefits not covered by Medicare. Payments received for care provided to veterans enrolled in the plan will be used to cover costs. The plan cannot operate at a Department facility unless sufficient medical care funds are allotted for that fiscal year. Additionally, medical services authorized under this chapter to veterans described in section 1710(a)(1) of this title must be provided in the number deemed necessary by the director for that facility during the fiscal year. Establishment of managed health-care plans with payment requirements for certain services provided by Department facilities. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, allows the Secretary of Health and Human Services to make Medicare payments to Department managed health care plans for certain veterans who are Medicare-eligible individuals. Managed health care plans providing care to these veterans are deemed certified Medicare Choice organizations under the Social Security Act. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code allows the Secretary of Health and Human Services to certify Department managed health care plans for Medicare payments for Medicare-eligible veterans. Managed health care plans meeting the standards are considered certified Medicare Choice organizations under the Social Security Act. Section 1729A of title 38, United States Code allows Medicare payments for certain veterans, effective after the enactment of this Act.
